usa: 1972 Nixon visit to China: President Nixon became the first U.S. President to visit the People's Republic of China, marking the end of 25 years of isolation between the U.S. and China.[436][437]
SALT I Treaty: The Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty was signed between the Soviet Union and United States at the Moscow Summit.[438]
Black Hills flood: Flooding in the Black Hills region of Western South Dakota killed 238 people.[439]
Watergate burglaries: Five men were arrested for the burglary of the Democratic National Committee headquarters at the Watergate complex in Washington, D.C.[440]
The Education Amendments of 1972, enacting Title IX and prohibiting gender based discrimination of educational institutions, was signed into law.[441]
Furman v. Georgia: The Supreme Court ruled that application of the death penalty outside of cases of homicide violated protection against cruel and unusual punishment.[442]
The Clean Water Act is enacted, was overridden by the Senate.<sup id="cite_ref-443" class="reference">[443]</sup>
U.S. presidential election, 1972: President Nixon was reelected to a second term, defeating South Dakota Senator George McGovern.[444]
Apollo 17 became the final mission of the Apollo program and last human spaceflight to the moon.[445]
Operation Linebacker II: The final major U.S. bombing campaign in North Vietnam began.[446]
